title: option to show password when entering it
content: Would it be possible to add a "show" icon to show the password as you are typing it in? It is so easy to make a mistake when you can't see what you are typing.
creator: JudsonMcCranie

title: Can't change font size of thunderbird 115  directory listing
content: For years we nolonger can change (increase) the font size of the thunderbird email messages listing on inbox messages (NOT the email itself). In the old days there was an extension called; themes & font size changer. Then you changed the interface for extensions and it no longerr worked. Nothing has ever worked since. After years of not using thunderbird I switched to Evolution. However recently I did find a way to do what I wanted by using the terminal window to launch thunderbird and increase the font using 'GDK_DPI_SCALE=2 thunderbird' as a terminal line command. Is this the ONLY way to increase the font of the thunderbird email directory listing of input emails? The fact that Mozilla never implementes the Simple approach of using Ctrl + and Ctrl - to increase and decrease the font as many other apps do, is beyound me. I'm not a novice, and have been a system software developer for over 30 years and used Unix in 1976 when it was from original developer Bell Labs. So what can I do other than the terminal command? I currently use Linux Mint 21.2 cinnamon and thunderbird 115.9. Attached is the nice large font directory inbox listing I get from running thunderbird from a terminal comand changing the GDI scale as indicated above.
creator: stevedonato

title: file copy failure

title: Timezone change when creating an event
content:
Hi, When creating an event in the calendar view, I get my timezone displayed (Europe/Paris), I set my starting and ending time and save.

On event display in the calendar, I immediately notice that the time is off by 1h. On viewing the details, the right time is displayed but on 'Europe/Dublin' timezone. Changing it back doesn't fix the time, timezone always change after save.

I took a look at my settings, tried to use "use system timezone" (= Europe/Paris) of forced it to Europe/Paris, even checked the config editor, but nothing changed.

Did I miss a setting ?

My calendar is sync by CalDav (using TBSync), don't know if this could be related.
creator: jb52

title: Thunderbird IMAP rescan all mails
content: Good afternoon. Tell me how to solve the problem that Thunderbird starts downloading all letters from the mailbox again every time after startup? After downloading all mail it works fine, but after closing and reopening Thunderbird, all mail starts reloading repeatedly. I use IMAP, all settings are default and only new messages should be downloaded.
creator: adreamtheme

title: Synchronize TB 'Sent' with outlook 'Sent items'
content:
Dear all,

I have set-up an outlook account on thunderbird, and I have troubles synchronizing the sent messages.

I have:

  • on outlook, a 'Sent Items' folder
  • on TB, a 'sent' folder, whose remote address point to imap://mailaddress@outlook.office365.com/Sent (which I can't change it seems)

So far:

  • when I send an email with TB, I obtain a 'save message error', but the message is sent and a copy is placed in outlook 'sent items'. And nothing shows up in TB 'sent folder'
  • when I send an email with outlook, it does not show up in TB 'Sent' folder

Hence, I have everything right on outlook, but all sent messages are missing in TB. How can I solve this, having 'Sent items' from outlook sync with 'Sent' of TB ?

Note: in TB 'account settings/copies and folders/, in place copy in, the sent items of outlook does not show up.

Thanks !
creator: cyril.gadal

title: Thunderbird Menu Bar buttona np longer work.
content: I have regularly updated Thunderbird every time new updates were issued. I don't have any add-ons, etc. Just have the basic version. For months now, some of the buttons in the Menu Bar don't work anymore. Specifically, "Get Messages" doesn't work. And, "Stop" doesn't work. To get my messages I have to go through the "Get Messages for" in the File tap along the left side. Then, it is a complete dump from my online email server into Thunderbird. I can no longer do partial downloads. It is a complete dump, which is inconvenient. I very much like Thunderbird and how it used to work reliably in the past. I looked through your help files and can't find anything that fixes the problem. And, I have waited for months for an update that resolves the problem, and none of your updates have fixed this. I use Windows 10. Can you help with this issue?
creator: hriadil

I've updated and reconfigured the email and everything else I could think of. And I can see sent messages, but all inbox messages are gone. Please help me fix this.

title: relocating t-bird profiles
content: I've been trying to move my t-bird profiles to a different partition, to free up space on my C: partition. I've tried following the instructions, but there are a couple of problems: 1) nothing seems to work, and 2) all the instructions imply that there's only one profile. My profiles folder has five, four of which seem to be in use every day. I've tried moving all the profiles to the new location and editing profiles.ini accordingly. But t-bird can't find the new location, and when I do get it running, it crashes, and I find the .ini file has been screwed up. I need to get all this sorted out, and will appreciate any help.
creator: natteron

title: email configuration
content:
Can not send messages messages from Thnderbird. Getting Failed connection to server error messages. So, I confirmed that the user id and password entered is correct. I contacted email provider and updated incoming and outgoing server settings to IMAP settings and confirmed they are correct.

I manually updated Account Configurations per the Thunderbird website. The server settings entered are confirmed correct when I re-test. When I select Done I still get the error "Unable to login at server. Probably wrong configuration, user name or password." I have confirmed that all of those elements are correct.

What now?

Email provider is Spectrum. Incoming Server type- POP mail server - can't change server type or won't get incoming mail Server name- pop.charter.net port 110

Outgoing - changed to IMAP - per provider advice Server name - mobile.charter.net port 587 Connection security - SSL/TSL
creator: cfnord

title: cartelle con nomi misteriosi
content: Buonasera. Con una certa frequenza, quando creo delle sottocartelle in una cartella, eseguo molte volte il comando "nuova sottocartella", ma non mi viene memorizzata, neanche riavviando Thunderbird. Spesso, le mail inserite nella cartella, poi, non sono più visibili e non capisco perchè. Inoltre la cartella viene memorizzata con il nome, ma con una serie di numeri e lettere accanto, di pura fantasia. Ad esempio, in una cartella di un cliente ho creato la sottocartella "contenzioso" e poi un'altra sottocartella, in "contenzioso", con il nome di un creditore (nel caso di specie, poniamo abcd) che mi è venuto con abcd183c47bd, che non so cosa sia. Un'altra, nell'elenco pratiche con iniziali P Q R S la cartella è stata nominata, senza alcun mio intervento, P Q R Sb88a687. Perchè succede? Grazie, Domenico Rosati
creator: domenicorosati

content:

I finally took the plunge after 21 years of Outlook v2003. I have Tbird mostly set-up to my liking with some chrome css customization's.

Primarily I would like to move the "Link, Anchor and Image" icons out of the drop down and have them stand-alone.

I see that i can move the borders and create more room vertically but i cannot find any toolbar addons that would give more icon choices etc or a way to move those from the drop-down?

thanks for any info/guidance/suggestions
creator: tahoedanis

title: Thunderbird account order and priority
content:
I have posted this as a reply to another part of this Help page but repeat it in the hope that I get a faster answer.

I have Thunderbird 115.9.0 on my Windows 10 computer. I have four email accounts listed and wish to make the one at the bottom of my list the default account so that it will send emails generated by an MS Access database. This did work a year ago then I switched back and now changing it again is not working.

Neither changing account order or setting a default account is working for me. First I just tried to set the account at the bottom of my account list as the default. Failed as priority immediately flicked to the top account. I then shifted the bottom account to the top of the list. Looked good but restarted TB and the list was back to the old order. Again shifted the bottom account to the top and then made it default - looked good. There is no action to "save" this setting so restarted TB - no, accounts were the same as last week. Please help. I need that bottom account to be default on Monday morning.
creator: dveitch

title: Trouble setting up mailbox for Thunderbird running inside Microsoft Remote Desktop
content:
When I try to set up my inbox for my email within Remote Desktop, Thunderbird does find the correct settings, starts to log in and stops with a warning "User canceled primary password entry" and then hangs while Sending login information...

Below that warning, it says Password OK but nothing happens beyond there. Unless I stop it, it stays at the Sending login information... stage for 5-10 minutes before timing out.

What is causing this cancelling of primary password entry? (as in nothing I'm doing).
creator: drgordon

title: ALL Folders Disappeared completely in Inbox/Trash/Sent/Junk/etc.
content:
Windows 10 Dell computer / Thunderbird 115.9.0 I attempted to move an Inbox folder (with subfolders) from one location to another in Inbox. Thunderbird crashed; only the menu line was visible, and it would not respond to any keystroke or mouse movement. I shut down the computer and restarted it. It took longer than usual, but the Windows home screen did come up, and all the program icons appeared, including Thunderbird's. I started Thunderbird, and to my horror, it opened with NONE of my folders. All the server information and settings for the two usernames I have (one for Gmail and one for Windows), but below the Inbox icon at the upper left, there was nothing below it -- no Sent/Trash/Junk/etc. icons at all.

Please advise. rehawkpe
creator: rehawkpe
